This is an unusual kind of question for this group, but does anyone
know an=
ything about the recent activities or whereabouts of Mat
Buckland?  For tho=
se who don't know of Mat, he wrote the book "AI
Techniques for Game Program=
ming," which culminates in a final chapter
almost entirely about NEAT and a=
pplying NEAT to video games.  The book
has been on sale at Amazon for years=
:

http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/193184108X/qid%3D1034633319/sr%3D=
11-1/ref%3Dsr_11_1/104-5338435-0523903

I know that a lot of people were in=
troduced to NEAT through this book
and I communicated extensively with Mat =
while he was working on it to
help make sure his NEAT implementation (which=
 is now available
publicly as "Windows NEAT C++" and also comes with the bo=
ok) was
working.  The book (and Mat) succeeded in connecting neuroevolution=
 to
video games in many people's minds for the first time and gave
credibil=
ity to the idea in the video game industry.    Mat has posted
on the NEAT U=
sers Group in the past as well, as I'm sure some of our
veteran members rec=
all.

I had the privilege of meeting Mat in 2005 at the CIG symposium. 
Rec=
ently, I even used his book as a textbook in my class on AI for
Games.  How=
ever, in about early 2007, Mat disappeared, as far as I can
tell.  The webs=
ite he runs, http://www.ai-junkie.com/ai-junkie.html
stopped being updated,=
 and stranger, he stopped posting to his own
forums on that site.  I no lon=
ger know how to contact him, and it
seems strange that he stopped supportin=
g his own site, which had been
quite popular.

Does anyone know how to cont=
act Mat or what he's up to recently?  I've
been wanting to discuss with him=
 some ideas about teaching AI for
games, but more importantly, I'm hoping e=
verything is ok with him...

ken
